title: Is it okay to repeat a grade in high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: As someone else mentioned, you don’t actually repeat a “year” as you might in the lower grades. It’s not unheard-of for a student to be “kept back” in 2nd Grade if he or she hasn’t reached the emotional, social, or intellectual maturity required for 3rd Grade. However, in High School, even though we refer to Freshmen, Sophomores, Juniors, and Seniors, those are just references to your year in High School. Traditionally, one would finish High School in four years. We often have students who struggle with the rigors of High School, especially when transitioning from Middle School/Junior High. We have many mechanisms in place for intervention when a student is in danger of failing a class, and even more for when that student actually does fail the class: Tommy fails Freshman English (or whatever it’s called in your school). Tommy can: 1) Go to Summer Academy (summer school), where he can work on those areas where he did not meet proficiency and hopefully receive a passing grade prior to the beginning of his Sophomore year; or 2) If Tommy was completely lost and passed NONE of his proficiencies in Freshman English, then Tommy will be repeating that class the next year. In this scenario, Tommy will either have to double-up his English classes one year in order to get back on track, or Tommy will be on the 5-Year Plan - four years of English are required for graduation in most US schools. Now, if Tommy did poorly in ALL of his classes - English, Algebra I, Earth Science, Health/PE, French or Spanish, Visual/Performing Arts - and managed to fail ALL of them, then Yes, Tommy will be repeating his Freshman Year. And, no, this is not OK, but not because he’s going to be in high school for 5 years. It’s not OK because there was a larger failure on the part of the school not to recognize that there’s a major problem here and to get Tommy into a 504 Plan or other Special Services to intervene and help him to succeed. Of course, there are students who fail classes their Sophomore/Junior/Senior years too - this is just one scenario, and the most common. Bottom line: you pass classes, not years. You won’t be “held back” as you might in 1st Grade. Whether you succeed or not is up to you and your teachers. But it is incumbent upon YOU to seek out help when you’re struggling - others might not always advocate for you as they should.

Yes. It is nothing to be ashamed of. A good friend of mine, is a really bright student. He knows his shit. Let’s call him Tim. Now, Tim is really clever. But unfortunately, last year he had some pretty bad circumstances. I never asked him for details because I figured, if he wanted me to know, he’d tell me. So he is now in he unfortunate position of having to repeat Year 10. And he gets so much shit from the asshole group of Year 10s now. They call him names. They’re mean to him. But what he needs is a good friend. So I try to be one. I always talk to him, I never talk to him about school stuff, just generic stuff. And he is having a much better time because all the members of his actual cohort (the current Year 11s) still talk to him, still consider him a part of it, and are still nice to him. And I think he’s a really strong dude for coming to school every day, repeating a year and putting up with that shit. So if you ever find yourself in that position, be strong. Be like Tim.
